### Find your local council  

You can [find your local council](https://www.gov.uk/find-local-council) on the GOV.UK website. 

### Email or write a letter 

Remember to include:

- details of the problem
- how the problem is affecting you 
- when and how you have already told the landlord about the problem 

You can use one of the letter templates on the [Shelter website](https://england.shelter.org.uk/housing_advice/downloads_and_tools/sample_letters). 

It may be helpful to include pictures of the problem. Make sure you keep a record of this letter and the date that you sent it as you may need it in the future.

heading: Contact your local council
lede: You should contact the housing team at your local council. They have an obligation to make sure that people are renting properties kept in a good state of repair by landlords.
